title: Australia Blasts Big Tech for Child Sexual Abuse Failings
snippet: Australia’s online safety regulator blasted major technology companies including Meta Platforms Inc., Apple Inc. and Google for failing to stamp out child sexual exploitation and abuse on their services, even after repeated calls to address shortfalls.

title: Musk vows to put data centers in space and run them on solar power but experts have their doubts
snippet: Musk vows to put data centers in space and run them on solar power but experts have their doubts

title: OpenClaw User Says AI Went Rogue, Highlighting Risks of Agents
snippet: Chris Boyd, a software engineer, began tinkering with a digital personal assistant called OpenClaw at the end of January, while he was snowed in at his North Carolina home. He used it to create a daily digest of relevant news stories and send them to his inbox every morning at 5:30 a.m.

title: The AI-Only Social Network Isn’t Plotting Against Us
snippet: There’s a corner of the internet where the bots gather without us. A social network named Moltbook, modeled on Reddit, is designed for AI “agents” to engage in discussions with one another. Some of the hot topics so far are purging humans, creating a language we can’t understand and, sigh, investing

title: Europe Takes On Tech With Social Media Bans and Paris Raid on X
snippet: European countries are taking their broadest swipe yet at social media, with a growing number weighing bans of the services for minors and setting the stage for a new showdown with some of the biggest US companies.

title: Thinking of leaving ChatGPT? Google may let you move all your chats to Gemini
snippet: Google is reportedly working on an 'import AI chats' feature for Gemini that could allow users to transfer conversation history from other chatbots like ChatGPT and Claude.&nbsp;

title: Redmi Note 15 Pro, Note 15 Pro+ goes on sale in India today: Price, launch offers and all you need to know
snippet: Redmi Note 15 Pro and Redmi Note 15 Pro+ will be available to buy in India from today. The phones will go on sale starting from 11am today and can be bought from Amazon, mi.com and authorized retail outlets.&nbsp;

title: Samsung announces massive price cuts on flagships: Galaxy S25 goes below  ₹75,000, Galaxy S24 starts from  ₹42,999
snippet: The Galaxy Days sale by Samsung on Flipkart features discounts on various devices from February 3 to 5. Notable offers include Galaxy F series from  ₹8,999, Galaxy A series from  ₹19,999, and cashbacks up to  ₹10,000 on select products.

Telegram's Durov says proposed Spanish social media restrictions seek to censor critics
snippet: Durov said in a message on Telegram to users that Spain's proposed legislative ‌package would force ‌social media platforms to gather data on all users, and its measures to curb hate speech would prompt platforms to strip content to avoid prosecution.

title: Google parent Alphabet says capital spending in 2026 could double, cloud business booms
snippet: Alphabet and its Big Tech rivals are expected to collectively shell out more than $500 billion on AI this year. Meta last week hiked capital investment for AI development this year by 73%, while Microsoft ‌also reported record ‌quarterly capital expenditure.

title: Instagram down for more than 10,000 US users
snippet: There ​were ​10,108 incidents of ‌people ‍reporting ‍issues with the social media ‌platform as of 8.30 p.m. ET, according to Downdetector, ‍which tracks outages by ‍collating ⁠status ⁠reports from a number of sources.

title: Cognizant’s Q4 net profit climbs 18% to $648 million, revenue rises 4.9%
snippet: The New Jersey-headquartered company posted a net profit of $648 million on revenue of $5.3 billion for the quarter ended December 31. In constant currency, or excluding the impact of fluctuations in exchange rates, revenue rose 3.8% from a year earlier, Cognizant said Wednesday.

title: O-1 visa gains ground; Anthropic triggers IT crash
snippet: Happy Thursday! Indian AI founders are turning to the US O-1 visa as a faster, more flexible way to move and scale their businesses. This and more in today’s ETtech Morning Dispatch.

title: Foreign cloud companies will get 20-year tax rebate, but conditions apply
snippet: Foreign cloud providers in India will receive a 20-year tax exemption on global income if they use notified Indian data centres and sell via local resellers. Domestic profits remain taxable, with a 15% safe-harbour for related entities. The move aims to boost investment in India’s data centre infras

title: AI founders taking O-1 visa route to get to US and build
snippet: The US O-1 visa, for individuals with exceptional skills, is increasingly becoming popular among Indian AI founders moving to the US. title: Fear factor: Claude Cowork, techies no work?
snippet: Anthropic’s launch of Claude Cowork, an AI tool for collaborative work, sparked a global software stock sell-off worth $285 billion. title: Govt eyeing 25,000 more GPUs as AI Mission’s fourth tender closes
snippet: The government expects to add close to 25,000 graphics processing units (GPUs) in the next few weeks to the existing commitments for 40,535 GPUs, a senior government official told ET, as the fourth round of GPU procurement is underway and is expected to close soon.
